thread.title: Arsenal fan writes and performs hilarious anti-Arsene Wenger rap following defeat at home to Watford
thread.title_full: Arsenal fan writes and performs hilarious anti-Arsene Wenger rap following defeat at home to Watford

author: sstreet
title: Arsenal fan writes and performs hilarious anti-Arsene Wenger rap following defeat at home to Watford
text:
Comments IT’S that time of year where Arsenal fans start to lose all faith in their manager. 
And Arsene Wenger didn’t do himself any favours among the Gunners supporters by leading his team to a dismal 2-1 defeat at home to Watford . Getty Images 4 One fan is so angry with Arsene Wenger that he has written a pretty unkind rap about him 
The Gunners faithful have tried protesting and ranting on Arsenal Fan TV, but now one fan, who calls himself Uncle Ed, has decided more drastic action is required. 
Keep up to date with ALL the Arsenal gossip and transfers on our club page plus fixtures, results and live match commentary 
A new anti-Wenger rap has been posted on YouTube which slates the Frenchman for everything from playing Aaron Ramsey on the wing to replacing Robin van Persie with Yaya Sanogo . 
Needless to say the fan probably isn’t too impressed that Wenger has just included Sanogo in his Champions League squad to face Bayern Munich . Reuters Arsenal were outplayed by Watford on Tuesday Getty Images Yaya Sanogo has surprisingly been included in Arsenal’s Champions League squad to the fury of Gunners fans Youtube - Uncle Ed 4 Wenger’s infamous £40,000,001 bid for Luis Suarez was mocked in the rap 
But most strongly criticised in the track was Wenger’s infamous £40,000,001 bid to sign Luis Suarez from Liverpool . 
Arsenal believed that the Uruguayan had a release clause that could be activated with any offer over £40m, but the Anfield club laughed the bid off. 
According to Ray Parlour , the new rapper on the block may just get his wish. Arsenal 1-2 Watford : Kaboul and Deeney strike early to shock Arsene Wenger at the Emirates 
The former Gunners midfielder said on the possibility of the Wenger leaving the club: “He would know if hasn’t done a good job this season, and I think he would walk. 
“He wouldn’t go upstairs, I think he’d go back to France and that’s it. 
“I don’t think he’d be part of the board. I don’t think he’s the sort of man who would do that.” Related Stories D-DAY FOR WENGER Arsene Wenger will divide Arsenal fans over his future more than ever if Chelsea beat Gunners and tighten title grip Draxler's dream Julian Draxler begs Arsenal star Mesut Ozil to join him at PSG... after already snubbing Gunners himself CESC MATE Antonio Conte won title on Sep 24... and Football Whispers reveals key moment that swung it A LOAD OF BULLION Marco Verratti’s agent warns Arsenal 'all the gold in the world won’t get you PSG midfield ace' UNLUCKY £13,000 Arsenal's latest price hike means the luxury matchday experience at The Emirates is yours for just £13k SECRET WEAPON Arsene Wenger surprises Arsenal fans by naming Yaya Sanogo in Champions League squad MIND THE GAP John Terry warns Chelsea that victory over Arsenal won't mean they have one hand on the title
